text: The Fitzroy River is in the West Kimberley part of Western Australia.http://www.freshwaterfishgroup.com/resources/Fishes%20of%20the%20Fitzroy%20River%20Murdoch%20University%20Ngarinyin%20names).pdf The Fitzroy flows into the Indian Ocean. The first European to visit the Fitzroy River was George Grey in 1837 aboard the H.M.S. Beagle. The river was given its European name by Lieutenant J.L. Stokes in February 1838 after Captain Robert FitzRoy. ==References== ==Other websites== * Influence of the Camballin Barrage on fish communities in the Fitzroy River, Western Australia * Omodei's Pipeline * Fishes of the Fitzroy River WA Category:Rivers of Western Australia
title: Fitzroy River (Western Australia)
